place.name: LITTLE YELDHAM
place.gazetteerText: YELDHAM (Little), a parish in Halstead district, Essex; 1¾ mile NE of Yeldham r. station. Post town, Great Yeldham, under Halstead. Acres, 938. Real property, £1,505. Pop., 307. Houses, 71. The property is subdivided. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Rochester. Value, £222.* Patron, the Lord Chancellor. The church is good. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
